definitions.definition: A favorable opportunity; a convenient or timely chance.
definitions.example: At this point, she seized the occasion to make her own observation.
on this occasion, I'm going to decline your offer, but next time I might agree.

definitions.definition: An occurrence or state of affairs which causes some event or reaction; a motive or reason.
definitions.example: I had no occasion to feel offended, however.

definitions.definition: Something which causes something else; a cause.
A particular happening; an instance or time when something occurred.
definitions.example: I could think of two separate occasions when she had deliberately lied to me.
I have no occasion for firearms.
Having people round for dinner was always quite an occasion at our house.

definitions.definition: A reason or excuse; a motive; a persuasion.
To cause; to produce; to induce
definitions.example: it is seen that the mental changes are occasioned by a change of polarity
